channel.title: Where do i DL jdk?
channel.description: Ive been installing JDK and all these compilers claim i dont have it so where do i DL the "Real" jdk?

item.title: Where do i DL jdk?
item.dc:creator: @jessica124 jessica124
item.description:
@jessica124 wrote:

[quote=“BurnInSilence, post:2, topic:183408”]google java for jdk
and for a compiler try

@echo off javac *.java pause [/quote]

Wow your so smart espescially when commen sense would say… Shes done that…

Ok third post i did what u said… But when i dled it said reinstall? So i hit yes and i dont have a clickpath? I have class path and its for JRE?

Read full topic

item.title: Where do i DL jdk?
item.dc:creator: @The_Prodigyscape The Prodigyscape
item.description:
@The_Prodigyscape wrote:

jessica124:

Ive been installing JDK and all these compilers claim i dont have it so where do i DL the “Real” jdk?

Your computer does not recognize java…
Go into your start menu…
Right Click on Computer or my computer and click open.
Find system proporties or proporties.
Click it.
Now if you are on a vista you should look for change settings or proporties or something along the lines of that.
Click it and find advanced.
Click it and find ‘Environment Variables’
Click it.
There should be a few areas that will say like ‘CLICKPATH’ and sofourth.
If you can see anything allong the lines of “programfiles\java…”
Or anything click it.
Change all of the areas that may say “1.6.0_3” to “1.6.0_4”
Now I am going to give you a link to download a JDK installer.
Extract it and bla bla bla then run it.
Wait till its done and save everything.
You should probably restart your computer.
I gave you that one compiler in another thread so you should try to use that 1.

Here’s link for JDK update 4 : http://uppit.com/R6BJTU

Read full topic

item.title: Where do i DL jdk?
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

google java for jdk
and for a compiler try

@echo off
javac *.java
pause

Read full topic
